message.content:
{"id": "123523", 
"title": "Bug 123523: Previewing a scripted data set mapped to a Java event handler throws NullPointerException", 
"description": "When previewing a scripted data set, a NullPointerException is thrown during the process of retrieving a class loader from the ExecutionContext. The root cause of this issue is that the context parameter is null in the method ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath. This method uses the context to utilize cached class loaders whenever possible. Two possible solutions to fix this issue are either providing an external map to be used as a cache or not implementing caching at all.", 
"OB": "The ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath method throws a NullPointerException when the context is null, while attempting to retrieve a class loader from the context.", 
"EB": "The ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath method should handle the case when the context is null and return an appropriate response, such as using another mechanism for retrieving the class loader without relying on the context.", 
"SR": "To resolve this issue, when previewing a scripted data set, ensure that the ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath method properly handles the case when the context is null and returns an appropriate response without throwing a NullPointerException."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '123523', 'title': 'Bug 123523Previewing a scripted data set mapped to a java event handler throws NPE', 'description': '(See ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath). The context will be null in this case. The reason for using the context is to use cached class loaders when possible. We can either provide an external map to use as cache, or not bother with caching at all. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'When previewing a scripted data set we try to get a class loader from the ExecutionContext. '}
